actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB; International Trade Commission; Office of U.S. Trade Representative; Treasury Department; State Department.

official_title: A bill to impose quotas on the importation of automobiles from Japan during 1982, 1983, 1984, and 1985.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of Commerce to submit estimates to the Secretary of the Treasury on the number of new automobile sales in the United States. Requires such estimates to be made at the beginning of each calendar quarter between the date of enactment and the quarter ending January 1, 1986. Requires the estimates to cover projected sales during: (1) during the subsequent six quarters; and (2) the calendar year during which the estimate is being made. Limits the number of Japanese automobile imports to 14 percent of sales estimates for each of calendar years 1982-1985. Requires quarterly revisions of the estimates to reflect any changes in the estimate of auto sales for the calendar year.

titles.title: A bill to impose quotas on the importation of automobiles from Japan during 1982, 1983, 1984, and 1985.
